part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Long ago the rivers themselves were ravenous, and they feasted on shale and limestone before taking bloated respite in the Great Salt Sea. Now the fissure-wounds have rotted to crimson and salt.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Long ago the rivers themselves were ravenous, and they feasted on shale and limestone before taking bloated respite in the Great Salt Sea. Now the fissure-wounds have rotted to crimson and salt.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Long ago the rivers themselves were ravenous, and they feasted on shale and limestone before taking bloated respite in the Great Salt Sea. Now the fissure-wounds have rotted to crimson and salt.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Long ago the rivers themselves were ravenous, and they feasted on shale and limestone before taking bloated respite in the Great Salt Sea. Now the fissure-wounds have rotted to crimson and salt.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶In stagnant pools, luminous lilies compete with the ribbon of stars in the night sky. Under the salt sun, though, they shrink into the shade of brine weed.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶In stagnant pools, luminous lilies compete with the ribbon of stars in the night sky. Under the salt sun, though, they shrink into the shade of brine weed.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶In stagnant pools, luminous lilies compete with the ribbon of stars in the night sky. Under the salt sun, though, they shrink into the shade of brine weed.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶The ivory sea's dunes are like waves frozen in place. There are cracks in the salt from where the earth, blistered by the jeweled sun, contracted and broke. The horizon melts the sky together with the vast plain of Moghra'yi, the Great Salt Desert.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶The ivory sea's dunes are like waves frozen in place. There are cracks in the salt from where the earth, blistered by the jeweled sun, contracted and broke. The horizon melts the sky together with the vast plain of Moghra'yi, the Great Salt Desert.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶The ivory sea's dunes are like waves frozen in place. There are cracks in the salt from where the earth, blistered by the jeweled sun, contracted and broke. The horizon melts the sky together with the vast plain of Moghra'yi, the Great Salt Desert.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Prismatic filament colonizes the cracks between the salted rot. There are meadows here, She says.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Braids of roots and ribbons of fronds dimensionalize the flat loam. Something's home a discarded leaf makes.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Thriving florae pack the loam with maze-dense roots, and a high-wreath canopy chokes off the last beams of light.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Spores dance in eddies across kaleidoscopic fungal bonnets. Rivers of primordial soup, cast in the light of lava, gurgle a quickening melody.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Hex prisms burst out of black marble beds, and their edges decohere as warm static dew. The Stair purrs at low frequency.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Blips in the wave graph of stone over time.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶In the wave graph of stone over time, where the world plates once vexed themselves into war, a quiet peace has settled.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶The grove's million laced fingers sway in gentle opulence. Verdant fronds nestle the base of the Spindle from its mountainous nook.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Water

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Svy urges over the salt-capped peaks and spills into the vine-braided loam. Her banks are shaded by the chrome carcasses of giants.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶The Spindle scintillates in watery effigy on her surface. She ferries crushed granite through a mountain pass and into her leafy firth.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶The umbrage of the boughs wrings the warmth from Opal's waters and leave behind a shady pool.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Yonth breaks the massif to the strange East and ushers its nameless waters into Qud. Fish-things feed on her basalt chips.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Old alps opened in the ageless past fill with a cool brine.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Coral fingers poke out from the spongebed and pierce the algal bloom, where white esh flock in the hundreds.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶An arcology of bright polyps arches across the soldered trellis of old, and a rich diversity of life peoples it.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Here crumble the mysterious Eaters' vine-swathed works, spun on the cyclopean lathe in an ageless past. Chrome steeples and parapets that rise above the clutches of shale hint at the labyrinths beneath them.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Rampant greenspread canopies a starburst of the Eaters' richest works. The jungle is torn at the corners, where crysteel balustrades and star orchid lancets peek through.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Ants in the viridian chaff, the farmers sap the last drops of pristine moisture out of the salt-spangled earth.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶In stagnant pools, luminous lilies compete with the ribbon of stars in the night sky. Under the salt sun, though, they shrink into the shade of brine weed.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Here lies the hallowed ground where the Spindle, a lengthless needle of maya blue, ruptures the tomb-dressed earth and pierces the firmament.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Through the umbrage of choking trees fly the hundred archways and buttresses of funerary monuments. They peer over marble arcades that roof the catacombs of the Eaters of earth.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Here is the jungle village of ape god worshippers and their giant mushroom dwellings.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶A naturally reddened outcropping of stone juts out of the salted crag.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶In stagnant pools, luminous lilies compete with the ribbon of stars in the night sky. Under the salt sun, though, they shrink into the shade of brine weed.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶The Six Day Stilt rises from the dunes like a petrified kraken corpse, bearing down upon the vacant flats.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Eyn Rogel

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Still erect is the superior half of the colossal gate inscribed with the runes of a hundred indecipherable tongues. Beneath its chrome palings a wide passage opens into the jungle loam.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Red qudzu vines take as their trellises chrome wells bored into the earth.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Shrouded in the rotting jungle are the mouths of the rust-caves of Golgotha, chrome's graveyard.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Eons-shifted stone entombs the angleless architecture of Bethsaida's lair.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Rubble encases this abandoned mine where ancient tribes siphoned the black blood for their own inscrutable purposes.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶An arc of rust paints the sky and circles the path once taken by gargantuans in chrome.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Tucked into a marble glade is the cloven trunk of Chavvah, the Tree of Life. Its fallen leaves lay like a mirrored carpet, and the dream wrens chirr a psychal carol.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: ▶Dyed pipework topology mounted in the spongebed is a lodestar to the lyrical community.
